intro: Galium matthewsii, commonly known as Matthews' bedstraw, is a flowering plant species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy habitats and is often found in coastal regions. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Galium matthewsii is a herbaceous perennial that thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments.
